title: Exit poll suggests Labour Party wins huge majority in UK election
summary: According to pollster Ipsos, predictions released moments after polls closed on Thursday indicate that Labour Party leader Keir Starmer will be the country’s next Prime Minister. Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s Conservative Party has been in power since 2010.

title: French elections: Growing reports of racist and homophobic assaults
summary: Racist and homophobic attacks and threats in France have been multiplying in the tense climate of an election campaign that could see the far-right come to power.

title: Putin says he takes Trump's comments on ending Ukraine conflict 'seriously'
summary: During the debate with President Joe Biden last week, Trump said that, if elected, he would have the Russia-Ukraine conflict 'settled' before he took office in January 2025. Putin said he is 'not familiar' with what Trump's proposal would entail, but thinks he meant it 'sincerely': 'We support it.'

title: French elections: Mbappé says voting is 'urgent' after 'catastrophic' results
summary: Star French forward Kylian Mbappé had previously called on young French people to vote at this 'crucial moment,' on Sunday, June 16, joining his team-mate Marcus Thuram in speaking out against the far right.

title: Frenchman Laurent Vinatier remains in prison in Moscow
summary: The researcher, an expert in the post-Soviet space, has spent eight years working for the Swiss organization Centre for Humanitarian Dialogue (HD), which specializes in parallel diplomacy. The Russian investigative committee is keeping the charges vague.

title: Israel announces sending delegation for Gaza hostage negotiations
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced, after a call with US President Joe Biden, that he had decided 'to send a delegation' to 'negotiations for freeing the hostages,' as part of long-running talks mediated by Qatar, Egypt and the United States.

title: Belarus's strategy of terror against Ukraine and government opponents
summary: Belarusian leader Alexander Lukashenko, a close ally of Vladimir Putin, is raising the nuclear threat while also conducting a ruthless crackdown.

title: French elections: Ruffin breaks with Mélenchon, calling him an 'obstacle' to gaining votes
summary: François Ruffin said he would no longer sit with the radical left party La France Insoumise in the Assemblée if re-elected on Sunday against the RN.

title: Tour de France: Dutch sprinter Groenewegen wins Stage 6 in a photo finish
summary: In his sixth career career stage triumph, Dylan Groenewegen carefully timed his efforts, sprinting forward in the final 4 kilometers to clinch the victory. Slovenian champion Tadej Pogacar, meanwhile, held on to the yellow jersey.

title: Reporters Without Borders says PR firm is posing as the group with imposter websites
summary: The Paris-based non-governmental organization (NGO), known for its work in defending press freedom around the world, said the PR firm Progressif Media set up false websites made to look like that of RSF. Vivendi, who owns Progressif Media, is partly owned by conservative French billionaire Vincent Bolloré and the company has denied the accusations.

title: Paris Olympics director defends David Guetta snub after DJ expresses shock
summary: 'I don't understand at all,' the world-renowned DJ said when he realized he was not going to be a part of artistic director Thomas Jolly's opening or closing ceremonies for the 2024 Paris Olympics. But Jolly says it's nothing personal: 'I have nothing against David Guetta.'

title: Small town dreams of restoring UK's oldest railway station for its 200th anniversary
summary: In the northeast of England, an organization is rallying to raise funds for Heighington Station, located on the world's first railway line, which will celebrate its bicentenary in 2025.

title: Hurricane Beryl roars toward Mexico after killing at least seven
summary: Mexico was preparing for the arrival of this Category Four hurricane on Thursday, after it it left destruction and a number of fatalities in its wake in the Caribbean.

title: Mauritanian President Ghazouani confirmed re-elected by court
summary: President Mohamed Ould Ghazouani, whose re-election with with 56.12% of the vote had been contested by opposition leader, Biram Dah Abeid, was confirmed by Mauritania's Constitutional Council, and is set to take office on August 2, 2024.

title: Seine water quality improves, three weeks ahead of Paris Olympics
summary: The previous week, levels of E.Coli – a bacteria indicating the presence of fecal matter – had been above the upper limits used by sports federations every day at the Alexandre III bridge location in central Paris.

title: French elections: What are the possible outcomes of the second round?
summary: After the final vote on July 7, the presidential camp is likely to lose its majority in the Assemblée Nationale, which has been relative since 2022. Several outcomes are possible.

title: French elections: Putin's Russia backs far-right Rassemblement National
summary: The Russian Foreign Ministry hopes that the far-right party will govern France. French intelligence services are worried about what an RN win on July 7 would mean.

title: French elections: Could there be an anti-RN governing coalition, from the Greens to the right?
summary: Should the far right fall short of an absolute majority, Prime Minister Gabriel Attal floated the idea of building an unprecedented coalition in the history of France's Fifth Republic, to avoid gridlock.

title: French elections: 'For the last two weeks, I've been exercising to calm down, but also in the belief that we're entering an era of combat'
summary: Le Monde spoke to people from across France about their personal hopes and fears in the run-up to the second round of snap elections that could see the far right reach power. Today, 48-year-old Jérôme Grillon, an animated film director from Paris.

title: When the 'painted lady' butterfly crossed the Atlantic on a magic carpet of easterly winds
summary: In 2013, this migratory butterfly was spotted on a beach in French Guiana. A meticulous scientific investigation suggests that it arrived there accidentally from Europe, via Africa, at the whim of brisk winds.

title: In Italy, Giorgia Meloni reacts to racist and anti-Semitic remarks made by young members of her party
summary: In a letter published on Tuesday, Italy's Prime Minister said she was 'angry and saddened' by the content of comments made by activists in the youth sections of her party, Fratelli d'Italia, according to news reports.

title: Dominique Eddé: 'The July 7 elections are a chance to say 'yes' to life and 'no' to death'
summary: Now is not the time for asserting identities but for them to coexist, in France as in the rest of the world, lest we fall prey to 'mental confusion' argues the Lebanese writer in an op-ed for Le Monde.

title: French elections: 'I'm not disappointed by Macron. It's a dog's job to be at the Elysée'
summary: Le Monde spoke with people from across France about their personal hopes and fears in the run-up to the second round of snap elections that could see the far right reach power. Today, Laurent Dunoyer, 71, retired from the communications business.

title: 110 and beyond: The extreme longevity of 'supercentenarians'
summary: They've lived through the First World War and traveled by cart. Today, 36 French people are over 110. They each have their own secret to their incredibly long life.

title: China is having trouble paying its finances
summary: Hit hard by the economic slowdown and property crisis, China's heavily indebted local agencies are desperately seeking new financing. They will also be demanding back taxes from companies.

title: UK general election: Labour's historic victory over the Conservatives reshapes political landscape
summary: Labour won over 400 seats in the House of Commons, ending 14 years of Conservative government. Labour leader Keir Starmer is set to succeed Rishi Sunak at 10 Downing Street. In a surprise move, Nigel Farage's far-right Reform UK party entered Westminster.

title: UK general election: Keir Starmer, the architect of Labour's triumphant comeback
summary: The next British prime minister, 61, has reshaped the Labour Party by marginalizing its left wing and rejecting costly budgetary promises.

title: What's the latest on the battle in Crimea between Ukraine and Russia?
summary: Since the arrival of American long-range ATACMS missiles, the Ukrainian army has claimed to be decimating Russian air defenses in Crimea as part of a campaign to cut off its logistical routes.

title: At the Elysée, silence and regret hang heavy in the hallways
summary: French President Emmanuel Macron chaired the last Council of Ministers meeting on Wednesday, July 3, before the second round of the snap parliamentary elections in which his majority has no chance of winning.

title: US left-wing media lift silence on President Biden's health
summary: Until the failed June 27 debate with Donald Trump, the age of the American president, 81, and his cognitive state had hardly attracted any comment from most of the media.

title: UK general election: Starmer vows 'government of service' in first speech as British PM
summary: Keir Starmer officially became prime minister of the United Kingdom on Friday after Labour trounced the Conservative party in Thursday's general election.

title: UK left's victory comes with responsibilities
summary: The historic majority obtained by Keir Starmer's Labour in Parliament must now be transformed into perceptible progress for the working classes, who have largely returned to Labour but are also being courted by the far right.

title: France-Portugal: Kylian Mbappé vs Cristiano Ronaldo, a duel of stars lacking inspiration
summary: Playing in his last Euro, the Portuguese captain had a frustrating start to the tournament, just like his French counterpart. The two men meet again in the quarter-finals on Friday.
